content.prompt: Which of the following best explains how the passage relates to the political process?

choices.label: Attacks on United States soil can mobilize the public to act and demand changes to the public policy process.
Public opinion plays an important role in the development of new security measures to protect the United States from internal and external threats.
There are important political and cultural events that can cause the development of lasting political beliefs across groups of people in society.
Citizens judge political leaders on how they react to the internal and external threats faced during their time in office.

topic.text: 4.4: Influence of Political Events on Ideology

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Explain how the argument or perspective in the source relates to political principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
